cards.flavorText: Beg me for life, and I will fill you with the glory of Phyrexian perfection.
cards.name: Glistener Elf
cards.text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

cards.flavorText: Truth is always a weapon in your enemies' hands. —Geth, Lord of the Vault
cards.name: Despise
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a creature or planeswalker card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.flavorText: We move because the earth does. —Bruse Tarl, Goma Fada nomad
cards.name: Tectonic Edge

rulings.text: Tectonic Edge’s second ability checks how many lands an opponent controls only at the time you activate the ability.
Assuming you can activate Tectonic Edge’s second ability, you can target any nonbasic land with it (not just one controlled by an opponent that controls four or more lands).

cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Tectonic Edge: Destroy target nonbasic land. Activate this ability only if an opponent controls four or more lands.

cards.flavorText: You serve Phyrexia. Your pieces would better serve Phyrexia elsewhere. —Azax-Azog, the Demon Thane
cards.name: Dismember

rulings.text: A card with Phyrexian mana symbols in its mana cost is each color that appears in that mana cost, regardless of how that cost may have been paid.
To calculate the converted mana cost of a card with Phyrexian mana symbols in its cost, count each Phyrexian mana symbol as 1.

As you cast a spell or activate an activated ability with one or more Phyrexian mana symbols in its cost, you choose how to pay for each Phyrexian mana symbol at the same time you would choose modes or choose a value for X.
If you’re at 1 life or less, you can’t pay 2 life.
Phyrexian mana is not a new color. Players can’t add Phyrexian mana to their mana pools.

cards.text:
({B/P} can be paid with either {B} or 2 life.)
Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn.

cards.flavorText: If there's anything a werewolf hates, it's a collar—especially Avacyn's Collar, the symbol of her church.
cards.name: Ancient Grudge
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Acidic Slime
cards.text:
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
When Acidic Slime enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.

cards.name: Forbidden Alchemy

rulings.text: If you have fewer than four cards in your library, you’ll look at all the cards there and put one into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

cards.text:
Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
Flashback {6}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavorText: Avacyn's protection is everywhere. From the holy church to the sacred glade, all that we see is under her blessed watch.
cards.name: Avacyn's Pilgrim

cards.flavorText: The murdered inhabitants of Hollowhenge impart to the living the terror they felt in death.
cards.name: Lingering Souls
cards.text:
Create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying.
Flashback {1}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavorText: Without the interfering hands of civilization, nature will always shape itself to its own needs.
cards.name: Evolving Wilds
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavorText: May the worthy spend an eternity in Blessed Sleep. May the wicked find the peace of oblivion.
cards.name: Pillar of Flame

rulings.text: A creature dealt damage by Pillar of Flame that dies this turn will be exiled even if it wasn’t the target of Pillar of Flame (because the damage was redirected somehow). If the target creature isn’t dealt damage (most likely because the damage was prevented), it won’t be exiled if it dies that turn.
A creature dealt damage by Pillar of Flame will be exiled no matter why the creature would die that turn. It could have its toughness reduced to 0 or less or be destroyed by another spell or ability.

cards.text: Pillar of Flame deals 2 damage to any target. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.

cards.flavorText: My flesh holds no secrets, monster. The spirit of Mirrodin will fight on. —Vy Covalt, Mirran resistance
cards.name: Gitaxian Probe

rulings.text: A card with Phyrexian mana symbols in its mana cost is each color that appears in that mana cost, regardless of how that cost may have been paid.
To calculate the converted mana cost of a card with Phyrexian mana symbols in its cost, count each Phyrexian mana symbol as 1.

As you cast a spell or activate an activated ability with one or more Phyrexian mana symbols in its cost, you choose how to pay for each Phyrexian mana symbol at the same time you would choose modes or choose a value for X.
If you’re at 1 life or less, you can’t pay 2 life.
Phyrexian mana is not a new color. Players can’t add Phyrexian mana to their mana pools.
The targeted player may have no cards in their hand. You’ll still draw a card.

cards.text:
({U/P} can be paid with either {U} or 2 life.)
Look at target player's hand.
Draw a card.
